title: Greek Prawns wrap
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 190°C.
Toss kale and green beans with half the peanut butter, salt, pepper and italian herbs; spread on a tray.
Season prawns and place on the tray. Roast for 51 min, turning once.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Prawns for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Tortilla wrap or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Sri Lankan Salmon fillet with Sweet potato & Carrots
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook salmon fillet 3–4 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry carrots and garlic with smoked paprika + cumin 13 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook sweet potato until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Salmon for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Sweet potato or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

Cook halloumi 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry mushrooms and peas with harissa 11 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the spaghetti according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Spaghetti or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Paneer and Kale Roast
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 190°C.
Toss kale and peas with half the almonds, salt, pepper and smoked paprika + cumin; spread on a tray.
Season paneer and place on the tray. Roast for 30 min, turning once.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Sourdough bread or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Indian Tuna (canned) with Couscous & Broccoli
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 190°C.
Toss broccoli and peppers with half the ghee, salt, pepper and ras el hanout; spread on a tray.
Season tuna (canned) and place on the tray. Roast for 21 min, turning once.
Cook the couscous according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Tuna for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Couscous or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Australian Chicken breast traybake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 190°C.
Toss cherry tomatoes and peas with half the butter, salt, pepper and italian herbs; spread on a tray.
Season chicken breast and place on the tray. Air-fry for 32 min, turning once.
Cook the brown rice according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Chicken for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Brown rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Greek Greek yogurt (0%) with Sweet potato & Peas
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat tahini in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook greek yogurt (0%) 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry peas and mushrooms with ras el hanout 19 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook sweet potato until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Sweet potato or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Green beans & Asparagus Baby potatoes with Pork tenderloin
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 190°C.
Toss green beans and asparagus with half the butter, salt, pepper and italian herbs; spread on a tray.
Season pork tenderloin and place on the tray. Roast for 32 min, turning once.
Cook baby potatoes until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Pork for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Baby potatoes or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Eggs Harissa plate
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix eggs with harissa and a pinch of salt.
Layer with onion, carrots and brown rice.
Cook the brown rice according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Brown rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.
